Reviews.Title: More than satisfactory for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jordan.Mo
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this TCL hdtv set to replace my older 2009 lcd 19" which I've bought during a black Friday for $300(yea that was considered a bargain for such a size tv back then). I placed my order this past black Friday and it came by UPS on the following Monday, faster than I expected. So if the early delivery wasn't enough here are some of my pros and cons:Pros:-Price - I did a lot of online research looking through bargains for a tv in the range of 22-32" in the price  range of $100-200. The only site which could compete with this deal would be what Best buy had with a 40" lcd tv for $200 and their other 22" for $80. Of course they were sold out across the US ( believe me I checked the availability online). So for the price I bought this for $169; which is $231 in savings, you really can't find such a deal in many if any other place for a new 1080p led tv.-Quality- I never bought any product from TCL but I was surprised at how well the picture and menu guides look. The remote control was responsive; I know some other major retailers feature a 'time lag' with theirs. The picture quality reminds me of my friends' 37" plasma 1080p tv, just as crisp. The sound was better than my old tv; it could be turned really loud so additional speakers weren't necessary.Cons:-Base- My only con would be that you had to assemble the base of the tv set, unlike my 19" toshiba which came in the package already assembled. If you have an electric drill then you probably won't be annoyed by that.All in all, for the price you really can't get much more than this. If you were looking for a decent led 1080p tv that won't break the bank then you can't go wrong with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Very good bang for my buck!! 12 volt!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Karen K. Radtke
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV before there were any reviews posted. It was a lightning deal for $159 so i bit. Though i just recieved it earlier today (so the verdict isn't 100% complete) i am so far quite impressed.PROS:: Price. Even at $200 i think this is a very competitive TV.: 3 HDMI ports! On a 24" !!:Headphone Jack: this is crucial. Especially since lord knows small led tvs sound horrible. The jack is also controlled by the remote. This is actually quite rare on tvs this size (i don't know why) but it is really handy. I hooked up a 2.1 Antec Rockus speaker setup i just bought and it worked great! And i could use the remote to adjust the volume. Thank you TCL!:12 volt! This tv is actually 12 volt (runs on a transformer when plugged into the wall) but can actually plug into a cigarette lighter if you just get a proper sized plug. PERFECT for an RV!!!:Picture quality: pretty darn good considering the relatively low contrast ratio. After some tinkering in the settings i got everything looking pretty natural. I also noticed minimal LED glow/bleed through around the edges  when the picture is dark. I was pleasantly surprised how consistent the blacks were.:Setup was easy and the digital over the air tuner seems decent.:A really nice guide/info setup for OTA channels. Even has a picture in picture setup goin on when in guide. A pleasant surprise.:Good looking frame. Nice glass stand. Doesn't look overly cheap.CONS ::Thick. For most i'm sure this is no issue, but at over 2.5 inches it is thicker than i would have liked for my purposes.:Not the greatest viewing angle. It does fade out a bit when off center.:the speakers are bad... But i was expecting that since ALL small flat panels sound bad. I wish people would realize this.In the end i think i did really well at $159 and i would not feel bad about having spent $200. Hopefully i don't have to test out that 2 year warranty!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the buck
Reviews.Author: Jon P
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item during the "Cyber Monday Lightning Deals" during the weekend, and received it on Tuesday, sooner than I expected. The TV was easy to unpack and set up. You do need a phillips head screwdriver to install the base, not a big problem though. It has plenty of easy to reach connections. I wanted a TV for my bedroom to watch basic cable and as a computer monitor. I just needed the coaxial cable and VGA connections, which was very easy to find and connect. The menu and set-up was very easy also, within 10 minutes I was ready to go. Beautiful rich colors and sharp picture on both basic cable station and computer screen.If you are looking for a small sized LED HDTV television I highly recommend this brand.

Reviews.Title: Not bad if it's not buggy.
Reviews.Author: H. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just my bad luck but I got a buggy TV. The first time I turned it on, the TV menu would pop up by itself after about 5 minutes. Then it pop up and off very quickly nonstop. It was late after work so I just gave up trying to figure out what's going on so I unplugged it. Next day I turned it on and the menu didn't pop up and off until about 15 minutes later. I thought it might be a bad remote so I took out the batteries. No luck.I went on the manufacture site and the trouble shooting section said for any issue, try rebooting the TV by unplugging it for 5 minutes. I tried that and the menu didn't pop up until 30 minutes later. I repeated the reboot a number of times during the day and menu would pop up between 30 minutes - 1 hour after I turn it on. At first it will pop up once every few minutes. Then the time interval got shorter and shorter until it pop up and off every second.Next day, I thought my luck had changed! I was watching for almost 2 hours and thought the issue had resolved itself. Then it happened again. This time, the menu popped up and didn't go away by itself. This one is going back to Amazon and a new one is on the way. Hopefully the replacement won't have any issue.As for picture quality (when the menu isn't blocking everything), it can't compare to my 2 year old Sony 40" LCD and definitely nowhere close to my brother's LED, but it's good enough for the kitchen. At about 3ft away, my Sony is crisp and clear. On the same 1080i HD channel at the same distance, this TCL picture is noisy, sometime pixelated as if it was a low def channel. The TV has noise reduction but it doesn't help even on the high setting. Step back a few more feet and the picture for 1080i channels look pretty good, but still can't compare to my Sony.I tried a couple bluray via a high quality HDMI cable and the TV report it's a 480 SD connection. Picture quality for animated movies seems a lot better than live motion pictures.The picture presets are horrible. They are way too saturated and the red bleeds for all of them. I had to use the personal preset but there is only one so I can't have more than one custom preset. I've dialed down everything to make it watchable. I still haven't gotten the perfect setting but the picture is not bad from a distance.Today, 12/6/11, the menu is popping up about once every 5 minutes and stays on for about 1 minutes before disappearing. The replacement comes tomorrow and I'll ship this one back. Just need the Amazon box to ship it back in.If it wasn't for the menu bug, I would give it 4 stars. It would be perfect for the kitchen or wherever you want to stick a 24" TV. The picture quality is pretty good if you can figure out the perfect settings. There are many different inputs and outputs. There is a USB input so you can access media off a thumb drive. The Energy Star rating is only $9 a year! If the replacement has no issue, it's definitely a keeper.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect... But for the price this is very solid
Reviews.Author: gmanvbva
Reviews.Content: I wanted to provide some quick feedback, since there are very few reviews for this TV.I recently purchased this based on a lightning deal. Last week I purchased a RCA LED24A45RQ on sale for BF (199).I still have both but the RCA is being returned tomorrow.I just received the TCL today. In my quick comparison this evening to the RCA... the picture is very comparable but the TCL did look to have a more smooth picture.The big differences are as follows.1. The TCL has MUCH better sound. Don't get your hopes up though. This speaks more about the absolutely horrible sound on the RCA. Small TV's like this often get critical reviews for their sound quality so I figured it couldn't be that bad. But it is. The TCL sound is more on par with what you would expect (adequate sound... and that's it).2. The TCL has RCA audio out jacks (red/white), which would allow you to connect external speakers. The RCA only had digital out for audio.3. The TCL has a USB port. This is obviously intended for viewing photos from a thumb drive but it works great for connecting some external USB powered speakers I have. The added bonus being that the USB port is powered down when you turn off the TV (shutting off the USB powered speakers).All other inputs and features are almost identical.I'll update this review again next week when I have had more time to use this TV.For now this TV is definitely worth the price. I'm thinking about purchasing a second.Update: Remote notes. I can't control this with my DirecTV remote but from what I have read my Harmony should work (once I program it) or this cheap remote has been reported to work for both.Sony RMVZ320Update2:I was able to program my DirecTV remote. I have HR24 and H25 receivers and RC65X remotes.Follow these steps.1. Press Menu on your DirecTV remote.2. Select Parental, Fav's & Setup3. Select System Setup4. Select Remote Control5. Program Remote6. Select Setup TV (or change TV)7. Type in TCL for make8. I don't know my model9. Select OK and keep the remote pointed at the DirecTV receiver.10. Test Volume and select "It Worked" (if it did)Exit and enjoy. Hope that helps some.If you have to look up your remotes codes on DirecTV's website, their are none for this TV. Also, if you have older DirecTV receivers/remotes it is reported (and apparently confirmed by DirecTV tech's) that there are no codes that will work.

Reviews.Title: I recommend this HDTV!!
Reviews.Author: Jamie S
Reviews.Content: Summary |: It's not fancy, it's not expensive, but it's a real good value HDTV for a small room.What's Great (:  So many inputs (I charged my (smart)phone using my TV one night!!) that are very easily managed and removed from the menu if unused.  I just use a digital coax antenna and the TV even has a (simple) guide with PiP!!What's Not Great ):  Lots of black is a little tough to see (cancel that videos-of-you-in-the-dark party you had planned) and I wish the remote had a sleep button.What You Need To Know ?-:  The TV's power box is not built-in to the TV, so plan on setting that big, heavy, warmish thing somewhere.  The viewing angle isn't very wide - you'll appreciate it most if it's in a room where you typically look straight at it.Compared To The Other Reviews /-:  Mine has worked perfectly for 6 months and the base was very easy to attach with a screwdriver.  I haven't tried to mount it (neither romantically nor to the wall).About Me }(-:  I'm not a tech wizard, so I don't know if this is "true" 1080P, but the picture looks real good on TV, Blu-Ray, and DVD.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price, with plenty of port options.
Reviews.Author: Matt Wilson
Reviews.Content: I got this for the black Friday deals (like others) and am fairly happy with it.Pros:-Great picture quality in general and good sound quality as well. I'm not looking for a Bose surround-sound experience, and this thing works fine for just a TV set-up in the bedroom. The video quality is clear, but needs some adjustment for movie viewing (the blacks are too low). On the other hand, for gaming the settings are perfect.Cons:-I personally hate the glass base stand. I put in one of the screws and actually made a crack. Not enough to hurt the stability of the structure, but it still bothers me that it happened so easily (wasn't even forcing it).-Viewing angle is sub-par. While for the most part I can see the TV just fine, the stand allows for no adjustment and even faces up a little bit, so if the TV is higher than your head you need to make some adjustments. I personally put a "eat this not that" book under the back of the stand base to lower the angle of the screen, otherwise it would've been unwatchable.So anyways, at this point I have my personal display settings with low contrast and brighter blacks for movies and the "ECO" setting for videogames. Awesome for the price.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to use this as a computer display
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I bought this one from Amazon, used, $174.  It arrived on time, to the day, and in the condition described.After playing around with it a while, I found several things I liked, and other things that were kinda disappointing.The good stuff:  Beautiful styling.  Runs from +12 volts.  Has VGA input.  Thin LED design.  Bright, sharp image.  It will provide images for DOS, WIN95, and WIN7 systems.  I tried it out in a variety of legacy VGA formats and it locked onto all of them and provided an image.  I will report later if I am successful in getting it to replace the old monochrome monitor.Disappointing:  The menu leaves off a few things I would have really liked... like a brightness control.  I also would have liked size and position controls for VGA monitor use, as my DOS and WIN95 screens have the top lines cropped off.  I also have 22" VISIO LED TV/monitors that do not crop off the top of the image.  The controls seem to me like the software team was really pushed to meet the Christmas season and shipped it before it was done.  For instance, once I connect to the computer, I have to cycle power to the TV to regain the menus.  The power LED flashes when it detects remote keypresses, but it just ignores them.  I find the lack of fitting the image to the screen exactly ( like the VISIO does ) to be quite an annoyance if I need to use an icon on the top of the screen.  ( the zoom control will still work in PC mode which lets me put the 800 x 600 pixel image squarely in the middle of the screen, which is small on a 1920 x 1080 screen ).  In native HD format (1920 x 1080), it worked properly with my WIN7 system.My VISIO also will go into sleep mode upon loss of VGA signal in PC mode, automatically waking up into PC mode when signal is re-established.  So far, I have yet to get the TCL to do this.Mounting:  The people who returned this obviously had tried to wall-mount it - and failed.  This device does not look like it will take well to wall mounting unless you make some special hardware for it.  It does not use the standard screw hole pattern, nor are the connector panels laid out for a clean flush fit against a wall.  ( the connectors are oriented outward from the thickest part of the display ).  If you have a machine shop handy, go for it.  But don't expect to go to your local walmart for mounting hardware for this.The screen will not pivot on the base, neither horizontally nor vertically.  Horizontally, no big thing, as the TV is so light you simply move it, base and all, to suit, but vertically, it could be bothersome if you want the screen to tilt up or down.  Propping the base leads to center-of-gravity issues.  I suppose if you were determined to tilt it downward, you could bend the mounting bracket ( I'll describe it below ) a bit.  I think you are out of luck if you want to tilt it upward.The manual is not too clear on this, but if you need to install the base mounting bracket back in the TV, you will need to remove the center two screws ( there are four in all, in a row, in recessed holes, along the lower back of the TV enclosing the electronics package ) completely with a #2 phillips screwdriver.  Then loosen the other two, but do not remove them ( three turns or so ).  This will get the cover loose enough for you to slip the mounting bracket in so the holes in the mounting bracket will align with the screw holes for the removed screws.  Now replace the two screws you removed - now capturing the bracket, and snug them all up.  Of course, you should have the lucite tube installed on the bracket ( held in place by the three "wood screws" ) before you try to install the bracket into the TV, as once installed, you no longer have access to where the lucite tube screws attach!  It was a bit of a head-scratcher for me, but eventually I got it.All in all, considering the price I paid, I will keep it, as I do need the hi-res display, LED, VGA, and 12 volt power features of this unit.  The hardware guys did well, I give them 5 star.  The software guys got a good start but they need to finish the job.. 3 star.  The mechanical guys get a 5 star for aesthetics, and a 3 star for placement of connectors that make wall mounting awkward as well as nonstandard wall mounting.If I had paid $400, I'd be miffed.  But $174, out the door, I'm OK.  Count my blessings - I did not get any bad pixels.

Reviews.Title: Wall mounting.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: People seem to be having trouble mounting this TV on the wall. If you read the manual, it says VESA 200, not VESA 200x100 or VESA 200x200. This is correct. It only uses two mounting screws 200 mm apart. Attach the two included brackets to the back of the TV above the inputs. After that it will attach to any 200mm mounting bracket.Also, it appears people are having trouble removing the base mounting knob. Simple remove the two screws above the mounting knob, and pull it down.I don't generally write reviews, but I wanted to address a couple of the issues people seem to be having. Other than that, the TV works fine. The colors do seem to be a little off. I changed it to the movie preset, and it helped with some of the washed out color look.I rated it four stars because the instructions are lacking (obviously by the complaints). But wanted to assure people that it is easily wall mountable, and the issues are more related to instruction rather than defect in the product itself. The wall mounting holes do seem slightly flimsy though, as it is only attached to the plastic backing plate rather than some internal structure.All in all, can't go wrong with this set for the price it sells.

Reviews.Title: Great value if your expectations are set right
Reviews.Author: Watch Wearer "disappoined with fine Danish watch"
Reviews.Content: Like most reviewers I got this on CyberMonday for $170 and the shipping was very fast even with Free Super Saver Shipping. This TV has replaced in our kitchen a 19" Philips which I got 3 years ago for $199, which in the day was a great deal, which in turn replaced a 15" Samsung. Those 2, older 26" Olevia and our 42" and 55" LG form the basis of comparison. This is probably the biggest TV we could feet between the counter and the cabinets since we have standard 18" distance. It goes under the cabinet as close to flush as practical. I will list what I see as pros and cons and then add more info that may be relevant to your buying decision:Pros: Easy set-up, decent colors, many inputs, USB port, headphones out, and pretty decent look.Cons: The biggest issue I found so far is the absence of VESA mounting holes - apparently you would need to purchase a conversion plate, or a wall mount that has adjustable mount points (prepare for more $$ if you will be mounting on the wall). I will also agree that unlike many others it does require a screw driver to attach the stand and the you have to be careful doing that or as someone pointed out you will crack stand "protrusions" that seems too thin for the size of the screws. It is a bit on the thick side as people noted, even with absence of built in power supply (there is an external one that comes with the TV)Other info: I do not consider viewing angle to be worse than many other flat screen TV's, not much different from my 55" LG, and for sure not worse than Philips it replaced. I also do not consider the sound to be a negative. Yes, the quality you get out small speakers can not compare even with a lower end sound bar, but by comparison they are probably better than the ones in the previous TV or in older 26" Olevia. The speakers are down firing, so it is possible that a close proximity of the counter makes the sound reflect better.My conclusion: this TV will give you a good bang for your $ if you do not expect sound like from the speaker system, do not mind driving a few screws and do not plan to attach it to the wall mount that requires VESA spaced screw holes.

Reviews.Title: Good, not great. But worth what I paid
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: Like most, I got it during a lightning deal for $149. I ordered it Friday and received it Monday. Unfortunately, the TV I replaced used a VESA 100 mount and this required a VESA 200. I ordered a set of extenders for $10 and installed the TV yesterday. I'll follow the lead of other reviewers and list some pros and cons.Pros $149, multiple inputs, better than expected sound thanks to an equalizer feature, multiple preset picture settings, multiple size ratio settings, 1080p quality.Cons: Wall mounting; it's a good thing I decided to use my VESA 100 and get extender brackets. A typical VESA 200 will not work. To make it fit, I had to install the lower extenders horizontally, which is normal, and the upper extenders downward at a 45 and 135 degree angle to fit the mounting holes. The second issue with wall mounting is you want to remove the neck at the bottom of the tv that mounts to the base. The manual gives no instructions about how to remove it but you figure out that you need to remove the cover to access the neck. The problem I had was that I never noticed the one black screw that was holding cover around the inputs. I easily found the 2 side screws but that one screw really screwed me up. Pun intended.I almost cracked the cover trying to force it off. Luckily, I spotted the screw before I did.The other knock I have is getting my Dish Network remote to work the TV. There is no code to program the remote to this TV. I'd like to avoid having to use 2 remotes given this is my kitchen TV.I'll provide an update as I get acclimated to this unit.UPDATE 12-20-2011: Thanks to Amazon shopper KT, code 503 will program a Dish Network remote to operate this TV. Because of this I raised my rating from 3 to 4 stars. I paid $149 during a lightning sale but I would easily pay double for it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV For a Great Price!  Mounting Is Possible!
Reviews.Author: William Rushing "twelveone"
Reviews.Content: Like most of the other reviewers, I bought this television from an Amazon Lightning Deal ($159.00) to put a TV in my son's room.  I was nervous as the price was low, but I am more than pleased with the outcome. I am using this TV in my toddler son's room.  The TV produced great picture quality for this purpose as he mostly watches the Disney HD channel.  I did play with the contrast and color settings a little, but even the preset options produced good video. The input options on this television are great for a TV of this price.  Most TV's with this price only have one HDMI port, but this one has three.  This really is a great TV for the price I paid.A few things to note:When attaching the base for the first time, the screws are very hard to get in.  It is almost as if the holes for the screws are not pre-threaded and the screws have to thread the holes when first screwed in.Since this TV is in a toddler's room, I wanted to mount the TV out of his reach.  This is where I became a little frustrated.  It took me a while to figure out how to remove the base.  You have to remove the two screws just above the base and then pull down on the base.  You then have to re-tighten the screws.  There is a cover supplied in the box to put over the hole.  The next problem was finding the right mount for the TV.  The owners guide says to purchase a VESA 200 mount.  I purchased the VideoSecu Articulating Arm TV Wall Mount from Amazon.  The TV comes with mounting brackets that attach to holes near the top of the TV.  There are not any holes to mount the bottom of the TV to a mounting bracket.  I used the supplied screws in the mounting kit to secure the mount to the TV.  I did buy some larger washers from the hardware store to insure the TV was secured safely.  Since the TV does not have holes to secure the bottom of the TV, I used some strong double sided tape to secure the TV to the bottom part of the mount.  The TV is designed to be mounted using only the two screws at the top of the TV, but I felt better adding the tape.  The TV DOES feel very stable and secure even with it tilted downward for optimum viewing. I have uploaded pictures of the mounted TV for everyone to see.Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase and would not hesitate to purchase a second one.  I considered giving the TV four stars since mounting the television was more difficult than most TV's, but since I have the TV mounted securely and it works beyond my expectations there is no justification for less than a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: very good for use as a TV but do not use as a monitor
Reviews.Author: Zhuochao Huang
Reviews.Content: for this size TV the price is amazing and you do not need to pay other fees on amazon.pro  -pictures are clear  -price is real good,and easy to use  -with out stand the TV is very liget and slim  -3 HDMI and a usb port which can use to review pictures in your flashdisk. the usb and one of HDMI are on the left side, so it very easy to connected even you mounted it on the wall.  -auto sleep with out signal input.  -auto brightness controlcon  -colours show not faultlessly if use as computer monitor(if only use as TV that is fine)  -can only view pictures not video via usb port  -use VGA can't worked on 1080P only 720P  -do not have any cable come with except power cord :)

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Scott C. Dragoo "goo"
Reviews.Content: I obtained this TV during the Post-Thanksgiving deals and I have to say I am very pleased with my purchase.  The picture on this TV is solid and noticeably better than my LCD and better than the other LED TV I bought.  I am impressed with the 2-year warranty and the TV is light and thin.  There are more dang hook-ups than you could ever use and the solid, glass base is excellent.  It looks great and it works great.  I cannot attest to the audio on this TV as I use other speakers for my sound.I would definitely by this TV again, at the same discount, if given the chance, and I have already recommended the TCL brand to others.

Reviews.Title: Oh well
Reviews.Author: Gerhardt M Bauman
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for the family.  Out of the box it did not work.  We were very disappointed.  Visited TCL's web site and found out that the nearest service was more than 50 miles away.  From the list there does not appear to be many places to get the TV fixed.  Lot of good a 2 year warrenty does if the repair shop isn't near.  Thank goodness for the Amazon return policy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent For Viewing Angles
Reviews.Author: Great Faulkner's Ghost
Reviews.Content: I replaced a one year old Philips LED/LCD set with this one, and I am pleasantly surprised by how much better this less expensive set works for my application, which is high mounted on a bookcase. I had to tip the old set down quite a bit to keep the picture bright, and from the sides, it would dim out no matter what I did. I knew that plasma sets did not have that problem, but I was not aware that some LED sets don't have that problem either. This set works great from virtually any angle, with no washout or fringing of the color except from the most extreme and oblique angles that no one would watch from anyway. So, if you have viewing angle issues, this solves them, More generally, the picture quality is quite good, and the sound is above average for a small set. It also has a fair amount of advanced controls for an inexpensive set, like black level, color temperature, and noise reduction. All in all, I am very happy with this set, and the cost was about half of what I expected to pay for a set of this quality.

Reviews.Title: Great picture after initial set up
Reviews.Author: IDGuy
Reviews.Content: I can't help but wonder if the folks here that are complaining about the picture spent any time at all setting up this tv. Out of the box, it's pretty bad but selecting the custom settings and turning off all of the auto choices allows you to fine tune it to your liking.I have it set up in my kitchen with a DirecTV HD receiver and for the $138 price I have zero complaints.This thing gets five stars for the combination of great picture, incredibly low price, and super fast shipping by Amazon. Ordered on Friday night and arrived on Monday morning.I realize that things can change and if this thing craps out after a few weeks I'll be back to update this. If you don't hear from me again, take it as good news.

Reviews.Title: Satisfactory
Reviews.Author: Michael P Matsui
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a few days now, and given the price, I'm more than happy with it. I think the picture quality is respectable, and I was pleseantly surprised to not have to hook up external speakers to it. My only complaint with the TV is that the vertical viewing angle is not great. I watch this TV approximately 7 feet away from it, and 2 feet below the base of the stand. When doing so, dark colors on the screen start blending together. Head on however, it looks fine.

Reviews.Title: Not native 1080p
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: When a product is called a "1080p LED HDTV" I expect it to be native 1080p.  This TV is not.  Hooked it up to my PC and it is 720p native.  Sure, I can set it to 1080p resolution but it causes words to become blurry.  Video looks okay but it becomes darker with just a slight angle and unfortunately there is no way to tilt the screen.  If you are looking for a cheap TV then this is probably not bad. If you want to use it as a PC monitor then I hope you like 720p.

Reviews.Title: Is it just me or does everyone have a sunburn?
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: People not everyone, but most look like they have a pretty bad sunburn. Reds just seem too red.  I'm hoping its just my TV because I want to return it for a replacement.  If the next one comes and everyone looks like they are three sheets to the wind......shame on me for buying cheap.Update:Received my replacement TV.  This one is just as bad as the first but for different reasons.  The picture is just plain bad, very noisy and again making the adjustments to fix any issues leaves all other video settings useless.  I get that I'm buying a generic brand TV...honestly they should have just made this thing an non LED TV, used better parts and charged the same amount.Don't be fooled by the positive reviews on here...this TV is crap if you want a quality picture.  If its just a TV for your kids to throw toys at, or to keep in a guest bedroom...I say go for it...but if you want to watch it and enjoy it spend a little more money and don't be cheap like me.

Reviews.Title: NOT for wall mounted application!!!
Reviews.Author: David J. Roberts "Doc"
Reviews.Content: Three standard brackets later I have come to the conclusion that there is NO WAY this set can be mounted on the wall. The mounting screw holes are in the wrong spot for any VESA standard or even universal mounts. The screws TCL gives you would not hold the set or any weight over 5 lbs. This was a big waste of time and effort. Amazon needs to post a disclaimer to warn people that this set is NOT WALL MOUNTABLE.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a small price.
Reviews.Author: Wild Bill
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as I needed a small set temporarily and inexpensively. It is a great buy (bought on sale).Picture is great. Some reviewers describe the sound as "tinny". Maybe so, but it is clear and undistorted, dialog is easily understood.  For the size and money for this TV you want Radio City Music Hall? If so, hook-up some speakers - there are connections for anything you can imagine. The stand does not allow for adjustment but that is not a consideration for me. It is wall mountable.I am so impressed with this unit that I will consider the brand if I buy a larger TV.

Reviews.Title: So far I'm impressed
Reviews.Author: Skoobdo
Reviews.Content: I had some concerns regarding this TV (24 inch model), based on some of the reviews.  I definitely had concerns about mounting the base plate, as it appears many people had some serious issues with that.  Well, my base and screws was attached in no time, like 3 minutes tops.  Oh, and I didn't know there was a black plastic ring that needed to be attached prior to screwing the screws in, so I'm glad I looked very closely at the installation diagram.  And THANKS to the folks that mentioned to spray some WD40 on the screws!  I think that may have made them screw in so very easy.I just received the unit today, and I have it on as I'm typing this.  I've set it up and I will tweek it later on, and watch it for the next few weeks and come back and update my review with any changes or additions.  I rate it now at 4 stars since I just received it and I'll need several days to determine the rating I would ultimately give it.But, as of right now I'm very impressed as I only paid $137.00 for this NEW and you just can't' beat that price for such a nice picture and the sound too (which isn't as tinny as most say after you set up the equalizer), and ABOVE all it can be ran on 12 volts!!!!!  That in itself is a major PLUS in my book.  I have it hooked up in my RV (which I travel and live in), and this was mandatory.  I used a 12volt extension plug that I already had on hand that I used to use on a 13 inch tube TV I used to use.  You can buy the 12 volt DC cigarette lighter cable from other retailers like Jensen who makes 12 volt TVs.  Matter of fact Jensen's 24 inch models are over $400, and other cheaper 12 volt models I looked at are not certified as "energy savers".  So, this was the BEST bang for my buck and I'm very very satisfied as of right now.If you're looking for a 12 volt DC power cord with cigarette lighter adapter from Jensen,(Jensen heavy duty dot com) the part number is DCCIG09, which they use for all their 12 volt TVs 19 inch - 32 inch models.  I think the amperage on the inline fuse is 8amp, and total cost for the cord is $9.99 with free shipping before coupon. You get a 20% off coupon if you sign up on the site.Also, here's a link to the 24 inch model's energy star information, which contains wattage and amperage info, and you can look for all other models too:[...]I have my unit set to ECO mode, and I also selected the mode that has the least amount of brightness. I hooked it up to a voltage analyzer, and the reading only dropped less than 1 amp while in use. I'm extremely pleased with this, as I do LOTS of boondocking.I will definitely come back here and update my review within 2 weeks.UPDATE (August 5, 2012):  I've had time to tweek the picture and sound, and I am VERY VERY pleased.  I can't believe I only paid $137.28 for this TV.  What a deal.  I use it throughout the day and in the evenings and I don't even worry about my RV battery draining, as I'm running this TV off of straight 12volt battery power.I wonder if any of the TCL 32 inch models run off 12 volt, because if I can buy one of those units (on sale), I'll put it in my living area, and put this 24 inch in my bedroom.  I will definitely purchase this product again. It looks good and performs perfect for my lifestyle, and so much better than I could have imagine.  As I write this review the price has increased to over $170.00 again.

Reviews.Title: great little tv
Reviews.Author: Karen R. Noger "scacampermom"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little TV for the bedroom. Perfect size, lots of ports for various additions like my computer, mp3 player etc.  Sound could be better, but all these smaller flat screens have substandard sound, a pair of speakers fixed that right up.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: dtwinkletoes
Reviews.Content: This TV Is everything they described plus more.Picture is fantastic very happy with set we orderedfor our bedroom. Two year warranty on set. I wouldrecommend it's a bargain for the price has feature ofmuch higher priced set.

Reviews.Title: How do you turn off the start up sound?
Reviews.Author: Neil Belden "Neil"
Reviews.Content: TCL if you are out there (or if anyone else knows) how do you turn off the start up sound? Reviews.Title: Exceeded My Expectations for the Price
Reviews.Author: Zul Javaid
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV up for amazingly low price of 159-. I did a bit of research on this TV as there were NO reviews as I got it when it first came out. The TV required assembly and seemed poorly constructed but looked ok. It turns out the tv is manufacured by the Chinese Military (no joke). They make a pretty decent TV for the price. The picture quality is great!!! Xbox and PS3 look awesome on this TV!! The TV has some interesting features considering the price (audio jack, pip guide, easy menus, nice led picture, 3 HDMI ports). I can pick up 50 HD channels for free over the air with a decent HD antenna(better than my other flat screens w/same antenna). For the price you can't go wrong accept for the chinese military links to TLC. :)UpDaTe: This TV still works after tons of use for almost 6 months.

Reviews.Title: TCL 24-inch LED HDTV Great TV :)
Reviews.Author: musashi
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv during the cyber Monday deal for about $170, not a bad deal at all. The tv came a couple weeks later just before Christmas. I use this tv in my bedroom so its the perfect size I was looking for. Setup was easy, there were a couple screws to hold down the stand and the tv together. Some people might not like the glass stand because its glass and not the usual plastic used on LCDs, but after awhile I got used to it so I don't mind. The outside frame also has a glass edge to it which is nice but creates a small glare if you notice. The screen itself does not create a huge glare effect from any angle or distance, that's what I like about it. There are plenty of HDMI ports on the back and side which is very convenient for gaming and blu-ray players. The ac adapter cable is somewhat short so I rest the adapter on my drawer instead of leaving it hanging which might cause tension on the ac jack which could lead to a damaged jack. One thing I need to find is a tv dust cover since the tv is small enough to be covered when not watching.After that, channel setup and display setup was easy and straightforward. The tv recognized alot of channels that I use from my antenna. One thing I don't like is how remote controls are getting rid of the caption button so I'd have to go into menu, setup, closed caption, cc setting, then ON, so adding a caption button would make things much easier. Other than that the remote is very easy to use. I like the guide button and the info button the most because they give me info on the channel and tv show. The guide tells me what will be on tv later on and gives me descriptions too, very nice! The audio is nice, its clear and loud enough for my room. Picture quality is nice, although sometimes people look a bit sunburned. If viewing the tv from a low position the tv looks dark but if viewing from a higher position the tv seems normal or brighter. So I might mount the tv at a downward angle to fix this. Overall this is a great tv and for the price you cannot beat it so I would recommend it for anyone looking for a small tv for a small room or apartment. Thanks for reading my review!

Reviews.Title: Awesome buy!
Reviews.Author: Chris O
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of TCL, and was wary of buying a brand I was unfamiliar with. The positive reviews on TCL swayed me to make the purchase, and I'm glad I did. High quality, low price, crystal clear picture. The only minor drawback is that it takes about 5-10 seconds to turn on or switch between inputs, but hey, what's a few seconds?

Reviews.Title: Great TV so far, Nice Price
Reviews.Author: Brent H.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about a month ago and I can say I'm happy with my purchase. The TV came pretty quickly, was nicely packaged. Took it out of the box, assembled the base, and plugged in all my accessories. One feature that surprised me is the TV has 3 HDMI ports, unheard of on a 24".I turned it on, picture quality is absolutely superb, very crisp and bright, sound is average, but better than most flat panel TVs of this size. I currently run a home theater system and an Xbox 360 through it to play games, works very well in that aspect. Haven't had a problem yet, comes with a 2 year warranty so I'm not even worried.Overall for 200 dollars, I would say it was well worth the cost. Even though I might be upgrading in a few years to something better, if you need a good crisp TV for an economic price go for it.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: DeeLaM
Reviews.Content: Got this on Thanksgiving for $160 - very good value for the price. Very light weight & took me less than 10 minutes to attach the stand/base to the TV - I couldn't get the screws to tighten fully so it wobbles a little but since I haven't moved it after initial set-up, things are fine. I would probably be somewhat annoyed or worried about breaking it if I wanted to move it around to set up other electronics. It does not shut off completely, just remains in a standby mode & wakes up about 20 seconds after pressing power on remote. Picture quality is good although it doesn't seem to want to let me adjust screen brightness. There are several pre-loaded settings I can choose from though (the usual dynamic, vibrant, normal, etc). I am very satisfied with the sound - I usually keep the volume at 8-15 & still worry about the neighbours hearing it (at 8 for action movies & upto 15 for soft-spoken movies; tv resides in a living room/dining area about the size of 1.5 regular-sized rooms which are not sound-proofed). Comes with 3 HDMI ports plus the usual AV ports. It easily recognized my DVD player & allows me to use 1-click zoom from the remote een after I adjust zoom from my dvd player - that is if my player doesn't adjust display to my max preference I can use the TV's zoom to get the widescreen effect. Overall, great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Brian D. Diefenbach "brian48fan"
Reviews.Content: First thing is to not be afraid of the off brands name.  Out of the box this TV has shined with easy set up, quality components and most importantly a great picture.  I would not hesitate to recommend this quality product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: If you think the TV is bad, try getting it fixed. **UPDATE**
Reviews.Author: W. Scroggin
Reviews.Content: TCL is a Chinese company that makes cheap products.  Some might say you get what you pay for.  I would say you don't even get close.  But I am not really talking about inexpensive.  Cheap - as in poorly made.It comes in a very nice box.  Hang on to it - you will need it to return the junk.TCL does not stand behind their products.  They subcontract to a pathetic company in Ontario, CA that will do nothing but:1.  Make you wait an eternity to speak to an agent who will:  a. Give you the option of spending $50 to send in your set with their UPS label or:  b. Give you the wrong address to send the TV if you choose to spend $10.30 to send it UPS yourself.2.  Once they track down your TV (only after you call 877.470.7766, wait an eternity for a live body to tell you that the TV went to the wrong address), they will ask you for your proof of purchase, which was provided when you opened the ticket.3.  You wait again.  I suggest that you take the time while you are waiting to write a product review.  I was actually connected to an agent after waiting 35 minutes and being disconnected 14 times!4.  Once you are done writing the review, you can read War & Peace.  Hopefully the call is answered before you finish.It should comfort you to know that A&D; Electronics is well known to the Better Business Bureau, from their site consider the following:50 complaints closed with BBB in last 3 years | 35 closed in last 12 months.Want to save some money?  Go to a bank and open an account.  Want a great value on a TV set?  Buy something other than TCL.**UPDATE**I received the TV yesterday after waiting a month.  The power supply that I had indicated was the problem when I first called TCL, was replaced.  Replaced with a USED power supply manufactured for a Hannspree TV!Unfortunately the power cord that goes into the power supply was probably the one I sent in - it will literally fall out of the power supply.  It should fit snugly.  Moreover, the end that plugs into the TV does not fit properly either.I can only hope that the voltage and wattage are appropriate for the set.  Since the TV comes on, that must indicate that it is fixed properly?  Guess again.  Oh wait - you are COMPLETELY out of guesses.  Epic FAIL.Amazon has way too much class to allow this to happen.  The problem is not Amazon's direct fault - however, they DO choose to allow substandard manufacturers to sell junk THROUGH Amazon.  It was not purchased through a 'sponsored merchant', but Amazon direct.TCL's choice of a repair facility in the US is an abomination.  I feel like I sent my TV to an electronics graveyard where a middle school drop-out was tasked with 'fixing' my TV with non-OEM parts out of a junk pile.I expect that Amazon will contact me to rectify this, as I am done with wasting my valuable time with TCL and A&D; Electronics.

Reviews.Title: Versatile with multiple inputs, excellent quality and picture
Reviews.Author: Andrea Polk
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 24" HDTV for a gift for my mother for her birthday.  Limited space in her bedroom (where the TV was to be placed) made me choose something smaller, and for less than $140 shipped I received a solid LED HDTV with a 2 year warranty.  A great buy and a purchase I would make again in a heartbeat.The picture is bright and clear, with several settings in the 'Set-up' menu that allow you to easily customize your viewing with pre-set views like Cinema or Eco, or with manual adjustments to contrast, color, etc.  The channel labeling is a cool feature that allows you to rename channels or inputs so you know exactly what it is, the way you want to remember it.Scanning for channels is also done in set-up and it took approximately 3 minutes with 'antenna' vs 'cable' as an input (rabbit ears attached to the TV) to find 10 local analog channels and 8 local digital ones.  All the major networks in HD came in clear through the digital tuner in this TV.  We will be hooking up cable to this TV, but I wanted to set it up with an over air connection first to check the tuner out, and it works well.The remote doesn't have back lighting so that you can easily see it in the dark, but that's not a big deal and certainly not expected at this low price point.  It gets the job done!This set would be perfect with a Paper Thin Leaf Indoor HDTV Antenna - Made in the USA! or Leaf Plus Amplified Indoor HDTV Antenna in your RV, or in an urban area with lots of over the air channels, and a Roku HD Streaming Player with Netflix and Hulu Plus subscriptions.  That combo could make cable unnecessary!I love that it has inputs galore! VGA (15-Pin D-Sub)- for PC monitor function, composite, component video, RF input, USB and 3 HDMI ports.  Outputs: SPDIF Out.This HDTV would be a great buy for someone who wants a 24" monitor for their PC and a TV.  Ideal for a dorm room in this way as it could serve as a media hub for a Roku, game system, PC, DVD player or just as a sharp 1080p capable HDTV.Sound and picture can be set to automatically adjust to what's going on in the room.  This is a cool function and I played with it, leaving the sound on 'auto', but changing the picture back to manual as it seemed to be too dim for my liking when I was testing it.My Mom loves the TV and that her Roku pops up as a channel versus having to switch to a specific channel like '3' to view it.  Amazon Instant Video movies come through crystal clear via the Roku on this set, generally streamed in 720p or 1080i.  She also loves the Sleep Timer function for Late Night viewing.This is a small HDTV with room for expansion via it's many input ports.  Great picture, nice sound with ports to add speakers for an even bigger sound if you choose.The TCL 24" is also one of the thinnest LED HDTV's I've seen.  Unobtrusive stand that's easy to attach to the TV, and an updated look that would easily fit into any decor.  The TCL 24" HDTV is really impressive when compared to the VIZIO E220VA 22 Inch Class Edge Lit Razor LED LCD HDTV I own in its design, inputs and performance.This HDTV is a super choice for anyone who wants a quality TV backed by a 2 year warranty for versatile use, without a big price.  You can't go wrong with this one.  Buy with confidence and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied!!
Reviews.Author: Alan Boudreau
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 24" LED TV on a Black Friday special.  I had never heard of the brand, but did some research, and discovered that they are reputable.  Similar to Samsung, which lived in obscurity in S. Korea for decades making quality products, TCL has been around for quite some time.Picture quality is FANTASTIC, and I like the functionality of the remote control.I gave this item 5 stars, because it works as advertised with excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price...
Reviews.Author: Philster "Philster"
Reviews.Content: I was torn between a four star and a five star rating for this television.  I went with the four star for several reasons, but let me tell you that this is a great television.  I purchased this on a gold box deal for under $200 to replace a 20 inch ten year old tube television that the picture had lines on the top ten percent of the screen, and was probably going to get worse.  I believe that I paid in the $250 or more range for that television, which could probably now be used to anchor a small boat.  The picture on this television is good, as this is a bedroom television used to watch the news in the mornings and some television late at night, it does very good.  I'd definately consider buying another one of these televisions if the price was in the ballpark of what I paid for this one.  I would have expected one HDMI input for a television in this price range, but this one has three, and has many other features that are mainly found only on higher end televisions.  I had bought my daughter a 22 inch TCL for Christmas the year before, and it has done well, so I was comfortable with the brand.Granted this is not an expensive television, my issues were minor, but are as follow:-  The remote could be a little easier to find the channel and volume buttons on.  I have several remote devices in my house, and this is the only one that has this issue.  Generally these buttons are more prominent and can be found easier without searching for them on the remote.  I wonder why they didn't recognize this when manufacturing the remotes.-  The base of the television is not bad, although lighter than I would have expected, but the user assembly of the base makes it seem a poor design.  I have put many things together in my life, and this one did not seem to be the best manufacturing concept.-  Instructions - not sure what to say about these, but I did not find the instruction book to be well written.  For example, the television has a wall mounting concept that requires only two screws, at least that is what I have figured out.  There were two spacers that seem to go with this idea, but the instructions do not seem to fully explain these and how to mount the television.  I would be concerned if using an articulated mount, but a flat wall mount would not be an issue, and the weight of the television should allow for even the most basic of mounts.  I don't plan on mounting the television to the wall currently, but that option is possible in the future.  This is not something that I want to find laying on the floor after the mounts did not do their job.  I would prefer to see a four screw mounting concept instead of the two.To sum it up, the main reason I give this television a four star instead of a five star review is the mounting system and poor instructions, otherwise this television has a great picture and features that cheap televisions don't have.  I'd consider buying another one of these televisions in the future if I had the need, and would recommend the television to anyone interested in a television in this price range.

Reviews.Title: completely satisfied
Reviews.Author: qw
Reviews.Content: I've tried a couple of 24inch LED HDTV 1080p from various brand such as Vizio, Apex and TCL etc, this item is the best in both video and sound quality.The 3 watt build-in speaker is more than enough for average sized bedroom.Factory setting of picture/video needs to be adjusted like this:turn up sharp from 4 to 6,turn color from expert settings from 50 to 42.It will be saved to Personal picture mode. Your video will become perfect that can match my 40 inch HDTV.The package comes with 4 black screws and 3 white screws.Black screws are supposed to be used for wall mountWhite screws for stand panel.However I used the black screws for panel stand, it took me only 15 seconds to finish all 3 screws.Excellent work, TCL.I'll load up your 55 inch when it is available on Amazon.com.Highly recommeded!!!

Reviews.Title: Cheap TV Does the Trick
Reviews.Author: rob
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Great design-Energy efficient-Good pictureCons:-Mediocre speakers-Longevity questionable (as with any non-name brand)I got this TV for my bedroom to have something to use to watch movies/shows on as I fall asleep. It has crisp picture and you can adjust the backlight to dim in a dark room (perfect for sleeping). The picture quality is great, and unlike some bargain brand TV's (I'm looking at you Westinghouse), this TV does not make noise when it is off, it is sturdy and the design is sleek, and all of the buttons etc actually work. Reviews.Title: Wouldn't buy again
Reviews.Author: Creative Shopper "Creative Shopper on Amazon ...

Reviews.Title: Beware - not mountable
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. Schneiderman "Dan"
Reviews.Content: The instructions state that this item is wall mountable "VESA 200 ,."  It looked like it was missing information, because it should state 200x100 or 200x200 etc.  So I called TCL customer service and they told me it is VESA 200x100.  It is not.  In fact, it is not wall mountable.  Or if it is, it is non-standard and will not work with any mounts you can buy on Amazon.  The false and misleading information from TCL resulted in a big waste of my time and money as I hired an installer to come to my house.  Do not buy this if you plan to mount to a wall.

It comes with the base for standing it and it also comes with the parts for mounting it ....you buy the wall mount.

The picture is great, even after two years of use. The sound is decent for a small TV, though it doesn't compare to a larger TV.Overall, this TV has been great. It works as well now as it did when new, which is more than I can say for a couple of name brand TV's I've had.

Reviews.Title: Mother-in-law loves her new TV and it has a great picture
Reviews.Author: Turtle
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv for my mother-in-laws bedroom.  It has a great picture and she has had no problems with it at all.  It was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Good Value TV's
Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these TV's for my bedrooms and they work well.  The only complaint I have is that the sleep timer is buried deep within the menu button.  I like to go to sleep with the TV on and am used to having the sleep button on the remote face so all I have to do is push it a few times and I'm good to go.  With this unit, you need to push the menu button, scroll down to the time settings button over to the laundry list of options, go down to the sleep icon and push the cross button several times to the desired time wanted.  Possibly on any newer models thay may have taken care of this feature.  Not a deal killer but annoying and inconvenient though.  For the price and performance, I am pretty happy with my choice. Reviews.Author: Danielle Woodworth
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV 6 months ago when I moved in to an apartment and was sick of lugging around a "flat screen" TV that was about the same size and weight as a small fireproof bank vault.  Yes, the *screen* portion was flat, but it was still a box.  Anyway, this TV is absolutely perfect.  When it arrived (very quickly I might add), I was worried they shipped the wrong thing because it was so light. I am not a TV expert by any stretch of the imagination nor do I have picky taste but I knew I wanted a decent size, decent quality, flat screen, light weight, affordable TV with a sleep timer.  This TV has everything I wanted and it continues to impress me with the fact that it was so darn affordable and still such great quality.  I've never heard of "TCL" and sometimes I get the sense that it's a group of college kids putting together cheap tv's in their garage for their start up TV business but I'm perfectly ok with that because this TV rules!

Reviews.Content: Do not buy under any circumstance . Warrantee TWO  YEARS what a joke . it will cost you fifty dollars or more to send it for a repair . Tech support not helpful . why buy something after a few months and have a hassle .

Reviews.Title: No problem, high quality HDTV
Reviews.Author: djmilhaus
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical buying this as I'd never heard of TCL.  The price was great when purchased and I've used this as a computer monitor for over a year.  No dead pixels, excellent color, plays Blu-Ray and video games very crisp and clear.If the price is right and you are worried about the off-brand factor, take a chance on this little guy.  It's worked great!Only drawbacks:- I can't figure out how to turn off the TCL logo screen when you first turn the TV on.  It's bright white with a red TCL logo.  In a dark room, it can be blindingly white.- Base assembly was a little annoying but got it figured out.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV
Reviews.Author: REB
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV a few months ago when it was a lightening deal for 159.00. I could not be happier with it as a secondary TV in my office. The colors are crisp and vibrant and the TV still is working perfectly. I also have it connected to my computer in my office via HDMI and it works alright as a second monitor as well. I wish I would have bought several more of these when I had the chance. Easily worth 200.00 to 289.00 imo.Cons:It's an off brand and I have read that mounting this thing can be an issue though mine just sits on the stand so it is not an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: Reason for purchase
Reviews.Author: Sr Newk
Reviews.Content: Need to replace the TV in the kitchen and this set has provided great service for almost a year now and saves money on energy cost.

Reviews.Title: For the price very worth the price
Reviews.Author: Joseph C. Church
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife's work out room so she can watch her videos.  It has every feature that we need and picture is very clear.  Like I said for the price we couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Have had for a year now.  Works fine, easy to set up and use.  Would recommend to anyone. Good product.

Reviews.Title: Great for my bedroom.
Reviews.Author: Kelsie D
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a Cyber Monday deal, and a deal it was. I was a little skeptical, because I'd never heard of the brand before, but it's a great TV for the price. Awesome picture and alot of features. I especially like the glass base, gives it a nice touch and looks great for display. Very happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: forbiddenapple "forbiddenapple"
Reviews.Content: This TV is a real gem, Perfect picture, runs on 12V thru a transformer, so if you want to hook it up in RV or boat, its a simple connection to make.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Snyder
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my bedroom.  It came on time.  It was easy to set up and works well.  No problems with the sound or picture.  Great value.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Shawna
Reviews.Content: The TV is great, it was easy to setup (the base does not come attached, of course). I think the picture quality is good. I tend to adjust the quality based on the type of show I am watching. The TV allows you to adjust the quality with one button without you having to surf through the menu. Overall, I really like the product and I recommend that you purchase it.

Reviews.Title: Works well for a bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel Galletti
Reviews.Content: We purchased this LED TV for our bedroom to replace a much older tube TV.Overall we are happy with the purchase.  We are not using it for a movie room TV so the sound system is just fine for a bedroom setting.  The picture is bright and there are several options for adjusting the colors based on what you are watching.It does appear slightly pixelated, more so than my larger LED living room TV, on non HD content.  It has a laggier refresh rate as well which gives images a sometimes ghost like streaking effect.Still it does produce a nice picture and the remote is easy to use.  Set up was simple.  We are planning to mount it to the wall soon and that appears it will be easy as well.Overall a good little TV for the bedroom to watch Uverse on.

Reviews.Title: Works wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Carlomagno
Reviews.Content: After I bought the TCL 40" from another seller, I decided to go for the 24" mainly because it is 1080p. So far, I am pleased with both Tv's one in my living room another in my office. Screen resolution is the best!

Reviews.Title: No complaints
Reviews.Author: debi collins
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my bedroom. Great picture, sound quality is perfect and has a 2 year warranty.I also have a 40 inch in my living room. Priced right.

Reviews.Title: HD TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis J. Bacon "dbacon1"
Reviews.Content: As advertised the only thing I noticed is that it does not have a s-video in which I wanted. Otherwise it is a good buy and has great picture quality

Reviews.Title: Great Deal !
Reviews.Author: Randy  S.
Reviews.Content: Bang for the Buck ! I got my TCL 24in 1080p HDTV and am very happy with it. Great picture, better sound and louder than my previous 22in  Vizio , and the remote is set up well. Factor in a 2yr warranty and I think I got a great deal for $159 and Free shipping from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great little tv!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Tillotson
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these TVs- both for bedrooms. We already have two 40" TCL TVs and are very pleased with the quality of the picture on them so I favored the TCL brand to begin with but also wanted to read reviews and compare prices for this size (24") TV.This unit wins on both features and price!The picture is clear and crisp. I can watch it from across the room (twelve feet) without straining to see what's going on.The sound quality is "small" (as would be expected from small TVs) but clear; not muffled. You can hear what's being said without having the volume turned way up. It looks like speakers can be added if desired.The TV doesn't take up a lot of space on the dresser.This would work great as a video game monitor for the kids (or for you)- the picture is so clear.We are very pleased with this product!

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: alvarezj
Reviews.Content: it is just as they said it would be...  I use it to watch my shows and for the price I'm pretty happy...no complaints here

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: mary k
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my son who was going away to college. The price was right and everything worked just fine. If your looking for a good deal and decent quality, I would recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad At All
Reviews.Author: AR
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for a little over a month and so far it has turned out to be a good deal! It has a lot of positives - 3 hdmi inputs, full HD 1080p, 2yr warranty, great price (I paid under $150 w/tax!) good picture quality and energy star rated. I have my pc hooked up to it as well using an hdmi cable (vga is also an available input), web pages look bright and vibrant watching programs on Hulu look really good.Assembly is simple, attaching the stand was quick and easy. Delivery was quick (it was delivered in a few days) and I chose the free super saver shipping option! The one negative was the box the tv came in, it was a bit dirty and little abused, and the top of box did not have sealing/packing tape so anyone (if they chose too) could have easily opened the box although it didn't look like anyone had tried to.

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV/Great Price
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Stuendel "DetroitFan"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 1080 pixel TV to replace a HUGE, old 27" tube TV.  This one with a brand name unknown to me was a bargain I couldn't resist.  The picture is great, the clear portion of the TV stand included is a nice touch, as expected the sound is a little tinny and thin.  For a replacement, second TV I'm VERY pleased.  The connections are easy to use, it's very light weight compared to my old tube TV.  The 24" screen size is just right for a bedroom without becoming a focal point.  Very good TV and a great value.  I'll consider TCL brand a strong competitor for my business from now on.  TCL stands for The Creative Life for those like me curious about the name.

Reviews.Title: Really good buy
Reviews.Author: pacmane
Reviews.Content: I've had it for a week now and this is awesome. I love it and it was totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: TCL 24 hdtv
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: I am using this TCL 24" TV as a monitor for my $35 RaspberryPi PC and for a standby TV as I upgrade to a new large screen TV. The TCL has all the connections you will need except for VGA. It does the job for the PC but as a TV it has loud enough but poor quality sound. The picture washes out if there is too much light and from viewing at very much of an angle. Don't give up on it if it has a blank screen, just start things in the right sequence. It takes time for it to change modes. In all, I got what I paid for and am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: molly
Reviews.Content: This tv was a good purchased.  The picture was clear and the sound was okay!  We use it in our travel trailer.  I would recommend it for a kids room, camper,or dorm, or a smaller living room!  And I ordered the wall mount that everyone had viewed, which I thought was the right one and it was not. So be careful when ordering the mount.

Reviews.Title: Perfectly Pleased
Reviews.Author: Edrick G. Coppock "BanjoMan"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV for use in the kitchen where I don't have a cable drop. Therefore, using it with an antenna. It has performed perfectly for the use I purchased it for.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: R.O.C.K.
Reviews.Content: The hd and blue ray are great, best deal I'be gotten on amazon.  However the regular channels are slightly below average.  I would recommend ONLY if you can utilize 1080.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price and quality.
Reviews.Author: alanp
Reviews.Content: This is a great small 24" TV, great for a kitchen, bedroom, garage, etc.  It's my first LED tv,  I haven't noticed anything more spectacular about the quality compared with my Panasonic LCD.  There is a good number of aux inputs,  3 HDMIs, PC input and RCA, Coax.  I currently have basic Comcast cable, direct connect to the wall cable and it worked perfect picking up both the digital and analog signals.  The internal menu / setup is pretty basic, nothing fancy.  The number of channels you can set for favorites is also limited.  But overall pretty satisfied especially when you factor in the price ($130)!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: gadgetjunkie
Reviews.Content: With such a low price and all of the positive reviews, I was pretty confident that I would like this set.  Picture quality is outstanding and sound is acceptable.  I hooked it up to Apple TV MD199LL/A [NEWEST VERSION] to watch Netflix and it is crystal clear.  Blacks are truly black and colors are rich right out of the box.  Very, very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: ChiefRobb
Reviews.Content: Recently bought a new Seika from Ebay for about the same price.  Piece of crap....I sent it back and bought this television.  Just hooked it up.  Want to use it for a monitor and television.Works like a champ.  Extremely bright and no issues with the VGA.  Automatically fills the entire screen when using as a monitor.This television is very thin and has a glass pedestal bottom.  It has style compared to a solid ugly black television.  I am extremely happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Elaine Franzel
Reviews.Content: A very nice tv.  We got this tv for our daughters, very small bedroom.  Picture is great, my daughter loves it.  Plenty big enough for a bedroom.  We have only been using it for about 1 month, but no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Desert Dawg
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv as a 3rd one for my motorhome, to use from the basement when sitting outside. It arrived on time and the bottom stand took only a couple minutes to assemble to the tv. This set has a full 2 year warranty, compared to only 1 year (or even 90 days!) on other units. The remote is easy, too. Like most flat screens, the audio isn't like my old Sony units inside, but this isn't a theater purchase. I'd recommend it for similar uses, or to have for a guest room, garage, cabin, etc.

Reviews.Title: pleased
Reviews.Author: satisfied customer
Reviews.Content: I found this television to have a very clear picture and good sound quality. it was easy to set up and program. The only bad thing that I will say is, it could have a more rugged base then the plastic one that came with it.

Reviews.Title: Beyond Expectations!
Reviews.Author: BerryVille
Reviews.Content: I received my TCL television quite fast, shipping within 3 days. The box was pretty light and I expected a tiny little average TV. However when i opened the box and took the TV out i was astonished. Its waayyy more sexier in person first of all. The stand was very easy to assemble, all you do is place the ring facing you on the clear part and then place the glass stand on top, screw in silver little screws and then your done! The picture on this TV is exceptional, high definition. All together the TV looks great.What I don't like about this TV is definitely the remote. The buttons are stiff and are hard to find because it doesn't light up and the buttons are in unfamiliar places. The set up was pretty simple. I don't like the fact that I cant play videos from my usb storage device. Music and photos are accessible though. The sound at first seems quite nice but after listening closely its deplorable. Good enough to watch shows at a standard level but when the TV is too loud it sounds like garbage.Nonetheless i am very pleased with my purchase!! I got mines for $137.28 which is not bad at all! I live in the Bahamas, my TV came without a scratch, malfunction or missing part. I Love IT!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great Price
Reviews.Author: Hungarianb0y
Reviews.Content: If you do not plan to mount the TV, then this is a perfect TV for anybody that has a price limit. It is perfect for college students, it is fairly light, and slim so it can be easily brought to college. It is easy to assemble as well as easy to disassemble.The TV itself has a great picture and the set up is extremely simple. It is fantastic for video games, with three HDMI cables, it suits all your needs. It also comes with a PC hook up, so you can use it as a monitor as well.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Psyche
Reviews.Content: After looking through every TV I could find and reading all the reviews, I finally settled on this one. I needed an HDMI input so it would be compatible with our Blu-Ray player and I wanted it to be 1080p. This seemed to fit the bill. It arrived very well packaged. The stand is an unusual design, but after reading the instructions thoroughly, it is fairly straight forward to assemble. Screw it on slowly until the stand stops wobbling, but don't force it or the plastic pegs will crack.Pros-bright, clear image-intuitive menus-4 HDMI ports-headphone jack-USB portCons-tinny sound (can be remedied with external speakers)-does not seem to be compatible with a universal remote-preset color tends to be too red, making people appear sunburned (can be remedied by adjusting the tint and contrast)Overall this is a very impressive TV, especily since it is replacing a cathode ray TV from the last century. I can't complain, especily for the price.

Reviews.Title: Its ok..
Reviews.Author: Tcat
Reviews.Content: For the price its ok the tv itself is beatiful remote also but the color an sharpness leaves alot to be desired for me. I wouldnt recomend this as a gameing tv in place of a moniter though for watch vids n movies it is ok.

Reviews.Title: Stylish TV
Reviews.Author: tommy
Reviews.Content: Recieved the unit quickly and once opened the colorful box a beautiful TV came out. Nice sleek brushed design with thin glass edge.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: SmartBuyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for $160 on Cyber Monday. I have to be honest, this tv is a gem. The picture is outstanding. Blu ray movies play great. I want to buy another one of these, but larger than 26".Where are the 40" LED TCL HDTV??? Can not find them. I know they exist. Walmart had them at one point. Amazon, please stock more TCL LED HDTV's!

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the Price
Reviews.Author: J. Killion
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV while being deployed and recieved it a few weeks later. I was a bit skeptical at first due to the numerous average and below average reviews of other reviewers that had a not so good experience with a HDTV that I haven't heard much about. But all of that changed one I pulled it out of the box and linked it with my Xbox 360 with a high quality HDMI cable. So far Ive had this TV for 6 months and it hasn't failed on me yet. I definately would recommend this TV to anyone looking for something small to take on the go.

Reviews.Title: Good TV Value
Reviews.Author: Old Man on the Mountain
Reviews.Content: The television was an extremely good value.  The biggest problem I had was attempting to mount the tv on the wall turned into a saga.  The orginal wall mount did not fit and my current mount only 2 out of 4 t mounting screws fit.  I would have to tap the mounting bracket to get 4 screws to fit.  It is a good thing that the tv is very lite.  The directions mentioned removing the stand on the bottom of the tv but never really got into how.  I asked tech support twice once via email and once by phone message.  Tech services did not respond.I would buy the tv again but their service and manual could use an upgrade.After a month of the TV I wish the TV had a clearer more crisp view but again at this price point a really good value.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: NokiaFan
Reviews.Content: Got this on sale on Cyber Monday for $169. Arrived UPS. The assembly was a little questionable as EVERYTHING is super CHEAP. HOWEVER, for the costs I can't complain at all. I would suggest this for anyone interested in a VERY low end HDTV. Sound is VERY POOR - as most cheap HDTVs are.

Reviews.Title: jksgoat
Reviews.Author: Hayden J. Guatreaux Jr.
Reviews.Content: for the price this by far is the best tv I have ever bought, the only thing I don't like is the mounting brackets, it is very hard to find a wall mount at the local stores, but the picture is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Skippypup "Pat"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter who was absolutely thrilled!  Great picture and so incredibly slim I was amazed.  Next time I should buy one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding product
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: This is the brand that sets its self aside from others. A super good price, and better quality than most HDTV that cost alot more.

Reviews.Title: moneys worth
Reviews.Author: francis
Reviews.Content: we bought this tv for christmas and we could say that this product is a real moneys worth.. the resolution is great.. the sounds is also very nice. this tv is so perfect in our bedroom.. Now we enjoy watching cable, movies and playing video games in our room with this tv.. The shipping was awesome comes on time and handled the product well.. thank you very much! you people make our christmas wonderful..

Reviews.Title: Very good TV! (for the moment)
Reviews.Author: diego123cr
Reviews.Content: This T.V. is very good. I just have it for a weeks but I still havent problems. The image quality is great BUT you need the first time adjust the image setting to find the right configuration, I spend a couple of hours doing this.I still have not proved the HDMI ans USB conection.

Reviews.Title: Second tv
Reviews.Author: nzbzm
Reviews.Content: The picture is clear and brite, good tv for a bedroom or office. Lacks option, no sleep timer input labels, ect.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: ffbarry
Reviews.Content: It is a great size for my room and it was a great price! Shipped quickly too! Would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: TCL LE24FHDD20 24-Inch 1080p LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: y3kserge "Y3K"
Reviews.Content: Tv looks great, very good picture quality (just using an antenna) and sound is good. Love the programmable features such as sleep timer and alarm. Great buy at a great price ($160)

Reviews.Title: Small, inexpensive, GOOD
